titlePart.text: MECHANICAL METAL-WORKING WITHOUT ESSENTIALLY REMOVING MATERIAL

titlePart.entryReference: processes for changing of physical properties of metals ,

noteParagraph.text: Combinations of operations covered by different sub-classes of class are dealt with in . Combinations of operations covered by any particular sub-class with operations covered by other classes, e.g. with operations involving removal of material, are also dealt with in , except that if the operations covered by the other classes are subsidiary to the operations properly covered in a single sub-class of the combination is classified in that sub-class.
Processes of a kind covered by this class but applied to non-metallic materials may be classified here if they are applicable to metal and cannot be classified fully in one other class.

titlePart.text: MANUFACTURE OF METAL SHEETS, WIRE, RODS, TUBES OR PROFILES, OTHERWISE THAN BY ROLLING
AUXILIARY OPERATIONS USED IN CONNECTION WITH METAL-WORKING WITHOUT ESSENTIALLY REMOVING MATERIAL

titlePart.entryReference: continuous casting , pressure welding by means of a rolling mill

titlePart.text: Manufacture of metal sheets, metal wire, metal rods, metal tubes by drawing
Drawing metal wire or like flexible metallic material by drawing machines or apparatus in which the drawing action is effected by drums
with two or more dies operating in series
in which the material slips on the drums
in which the material does not slip on the drums
with accumulation of material between consecutively-arranged dies
Regulating or controlling speed of drawing drums, e.g. to influence tension

titlePart.entryReference: design or construction of electrical equipment, see the relevant classes

titlePart.text: Grippers specially adapted for drawing machines or apparatus of the drum type
Couplings specially adapted for these drums

Metal drawing by machines or apparatus in which the drawing action is effected by other means than drums, e.g. by a longitudinally-moved carriage pulling or pushing the work or stock for making metal sheets, bars, or tubes
from stock of essentially unlimited length
specially adapted for making tubular articles
titlePart.entryReference: bending sheet metal into tubular form by drawing
for drawing machines of the drum type

titlePart.text: Feeding or discharging the material or mandrels
Guiding or supporting the material or mandrels
with section defined by rollers, balls, or the like
with hydraulic forces acting immediately on work
Die holders combined with devices for guiding the drawing material or combined with devices for cooling, heating, or lubricating
Making tools by operations not covered by a single other sub-class
Cooling, heating or lubricating drawing material
Devices for straightening wire or like work combined with or specially adapted for use in connection with drawing or winding machines or apparatus
starting from material of particular form or shape, e.g. mechanically pre-treated
titlePart.entryReference: heat treatment or combinations thereof with mechanical treatments, see appropriate classes

titlePart.text: by both direct and backward extrusion
Presses specially adapted for extruding metal
Making products from two or more metals
Covering indefinite lengths of metal or non-metal material with a metal coating
Applying metal coats to cables, e.g. to insulated electric cables
Lubrication of metal being extruded or of dies, etc., e.g. physical state of lubricant, location where lubricant is applied (chemical composition, see appropriate classes)
Press heads, dies, or mandrels for coating work
Dies or mandrels with section variable during extruding, e. g for making tapered work
Making tools by operations not covered by a single other sub-class
Containers for metal to be extruded
Cooling or heating work or parts of the extrusion press
of containers for metal to be extruded
of press heads, dies, or mandrels
Control devices, e.g. for regulating the pressing speed or temperature of metal
Measuring devices, e.g. for temperature of metal, combined with or specially adapted for use in connection with extrusion presses
titlePart.entryReference: measuring devices of more general interest within sub-class , see group

titlePart.text: Feeding extrusion presses with metal to be extruded
the metal being in liquid form
Removing work or waste from extruding presses

titlePart.entryReference: in connection with the extruding of bent tubes or rods

titlePart.text: Cleaning dies, ducts, containers, or mandrels
Cleaning dies, ducts, containers or mandrels
Manufacture of metal sheets, bars, wire, tubes or like semi-manufactured products, not otherwise provided for
titlePart.entryReference: by drawing or extruding, see the relevant groups
by working or processing semi-finished sheet metal, profiles, tubes, or wire ,
by welding, e.g. cladding or plating

titlePart.text: Manufacture of tubes of special shape
Combined procedures for making tubes, e.g. for making multi-wall tubes
Making tubes with welded or soldered seams
titlePart.entryReference: involving only a soldering or welding operation

titlePart.text: Supply, or operations combined with supply, of strip material
using rods or strips of soldering material
Making tubes or metal hoses with helically arranged seams
Making tubes from doubled flat material
Making tubes with varying diameter in longitudinal direction
Making helical or similar guides in or on tubes without removing material, e.g. by drawing same over mandrels, by pushing same through dies
Making finned or ribbed tubes by fixing strip or like material to tubes
Making tube fittings for connecting pipes, e.g. U-pieces

titlePart.entryReference: finishing operations per se, see the relevant classes

titlePart.text: Devices for cleaning metal products combined with or specially adapted for use with machines or apparatus provided for in this sub-class
combined with or specially adapted for use in connection with drawing or winding machines or apparatus
Devices for de-scaling wire or like flexible work
Auxiliary operations used in connection with metal working without essentially removing material
Separating mandrels from work or vice versa
Winding-up, coiling or winding-off metal wire, metal band or other flexible metal material characterised by features relevant to metal processing only
titlePart.entryReference: winding or unwinding in general, drives therefor, regulating or controlling winding speed or tension of material being wound, in general
hot coilers in connection with heat-treatment apparatus

titlePart.text: on or in reels or drums, without using a moving guide
with loaded rollers, bolts, or equivalent means holding the material on the reel or drum
without making use of a reel or drum, the first turn being formed by a stationary guide
by means of a moving guide
the guide moving parallel to the axis of the coil
by means of a rotating guide, e.g. laying the material around a stationary reel or drum
the unreeled material moving transversely to the tangent line of the drum, e.g. axially, radially
Unwinding coils without reels or drums
Transferring coils to or from winding apparatus or to or from operative position therein
Special arrangements with regard to simultaneous or subsequent treatment of the material
Tongs or gripping means specially adapted for reeling operations
Feeding or guiding devices not specially adapted to a particular type of apparatus
Measuring, gauging, indicating, counting, or marking devices specially adapted for use in the production or manipulation of material in accordance with sub-classes
